document.masterDocTitle: Description of five new and six known species of the genus Basirotyleptus Jairajpuri, 1964 (Nematoda: Dorylaimida: Tylencholaimoidea) from the Western Ghats, India

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of five new and six known species of the genus Basirotyleptus Jairajpuri, 1964 (Nematoda: Dorylaimida: Tylencholaimoidea) from the Western Ghats, India

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Nematode Biodiversity Research Lab, Department of Zoology, Aligarh Muslim University, Aligarh- 202002, India.
Nematode Biodiversity Research Lab, Department of Zoology, Aligarh Muslim University, Aligarh- 202002, India.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Key to species of the genus
Basirotyleptus
(modified after
Goseco et al . 1974
)

paragraph.keyLead:
4. Body length more than 0.6 mm ; spicules longer, 24–28 µm ...............
B. lieberi Goseco et al ., 1970

5. Odontophore with basal flanges; post-uterine sac long, 1.8–3.5 times midbody diameter long; tail comparatively long, conoid, 18–28 µm .................................................
B. heynsi Furstenberg, 1980

– Odontophore without basal flanges; post-uterine sac short, 1.2 times midbody diameter long; tail short, conoid, 15 µm ......................................................................
B. eximius Siddiqi & Khan, 1964
9. Anterior uterine sac <15 µm or less than one midbody diameter long .......................................... 10
– Anterior uterine sac> 15 µm or more than one midbody diameter long ....................................... 12

15. Pharynx short, 90 µm, b = 4.7–6.0; V = 36–43; c = 42–44 .......
B. modestus Hussain & Khan, 1968

16. Odontostyle 6.0 µm, odonotophore 10.5–11 µm; spicules 24 µm .............
B. barbarae Siddiqi, 1997

– Odontostyle 7.5–8.5 µm, odonotophore 12–15 µm; spicules 29–32 µm ....
B. robustus Siddiqi, 1982
– Odontophore simple, with sclerotized or slightly swollen base, not flanged ................................. 25
– Body 0.30–0.51 mm long; posterior uterine sac about as long as midbody diameter long ............ 20

– Tail short, conoid with acute terminus; c <28 ............................................
B. conicuadatus
sp. nov.

21. Odontostyle 9.0–10 µm; neck length 110–119 µm ................................
B. syncheillus Siddiqi, 1995

28. V = 31–41; tail rounded, with terminal caudal pore ...............................
B. acus
Goseco et al ., 1974

– V = 47–48; tail conoid, without terminal caudal pore .........
B. soueastus Ahmad & Jairajpuri, 1979

31. Cuticle without punctations; amphids stirrup-shaped ...............
B. upicus Ahmad & Jairajpuri, 1979
33. Anterior uterine sac more than one midbody diameter long .......................................................... 34
– Anterior uterine sac less than one midbody diameter long ............................................................. 35

35. Lip region distinctly offset; odontostyle, 11–15 µm ............................
B. pini Siddiqi & Khan, 1965

– Lip region distinctly not offset; odontostyle, 4.6 µm .........
B. striatus (Thorne, 1964) Siddiqi, 1969
